close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between

sentences.english: Pic. o2 Jacqueline Urbina: An ener with nature during a walk on Exuma Island, Bahamas.

sentences.english: Slip away to innocent days with this fantastically fun collection of jigsaws with a nostalgic theme.
sentences.chinese: 溜掉无辜天这个亲密乐趣收集灵感与怀旧主题。

sentences.english: Aeriform lieutenant general does group of relations intimately to be done aloof and tensely originally.
sentences.chinese: 无形中将原本亲密的干群关系弄得疏远而紧张了。

sentences.english: Softly press to wear make-up, as the closest comfort from the lover.
sentences.chinese: 以轻压方式上妆，仿佛恋人最亲密的爱抚。

sentences.english: What makes them want to be intimate?
The lack of proprieties would make the most intimate friends turn to be the most decided enemies.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏礼节会使最亲密的朋友变成不共戴天的仇敌。

sentences.english: Liu Ying is my closest friend.
sentences.chinese: 刘莺是我最亲密的朋友。

sentences.english: Sharing feelings and experiences is the next level of vulnerability and intimacy.
sentences.chinese: 分享感受和经历是脆弱性与亲密性的后一层次。

sentences.english: Zardari said the two countries are all-weather close friends.
sentences.chinese: 扎尔达里表示，巴中是全天候的亲密朋友。

sentences.english: Airdrie, you were my best friend and my closest connection.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔德里你是我最好的朋友和最亲密的人。

sentences.english: It likes you quite a lot. It seems to want to be babied a little.
sentences.chinese: 相当亲密呀，似乎想对你撒娇的样子。

sentences.english: The cure for triangulation is trust and intimacy.
sentences.chinese: 互相信任与亲密无间是根治第三方卷入的良方。

sentences.english: They conversed with the familiarity of a long-established acquaintance.
sentences.chinese: 他们俨然如老相识一样亲密无间地攀谈了。

sentences.english: She allowed him to hold her hand, but forbade him any intimacies.
sentences.chinese: 她让他握着手，但不许他有过份亲密的行动。

sentences.english: But the police tend to be hand-in-glove with popular newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 而警方往往与大众报纸来往亲密。

sentences.english: How close is too close when it comes to mothers and sons?
sentences.chinese: 母子间的亲密到底有没有底线？

definition: close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
harmonious/friendly relations/on good terms with one another
to drift apart/to become estranged/to alienate/estrangement
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
